film_condensed: Duke of York (Bertie) asked to give speech at the Empire exhibition.
Bertie looks very anxious.
The BBC crew prepare.
reality_condensed: BBC folk take their voices seriously.

film_condensed: Bertie looks terrified.
reality_condensed: Bertie was terrified of public speaking.

film_condensed: The BBC introduce Bertie.
Bertie stammers, is humiliated.
Sir Bentham arrives.
reality_condensed: Bertie saw a lot of doctors.

film_condensed: Bertie is encouraged to put marbles in his mouth by Sir Bentham.
Elizabeth curtly thanks the Dr.
Elizabeth calms Bertie down.
Elizabeth is driven to Harley Street
reality_condensed: Elizabeth didn't set up the meeting in person.

film_condensed: Elizabeth enters, looks dubious.
reality_condensed: Elizabeth didn't set up the meeting in person.

film_condensed: Elizabeth & Lionel speak.
reality_condensed: Elizabeth didn't set up the meeting in person.

film_condensed: Elizabeth demands Lionel attend their home. Lionel refuses.
reality_condensed: Lionel knew who Bertie was from day one.

film_condensed: LionelS arrives at his small family home.
reality_condensed: Lionel lived in a small house with his wife & 3 kids.

film_condensed: Bertie struggles to read a bedtime story.
reality_condensed: Bertie loved his kids & may have struggled to speak around them.

film_condensed: Elizabeth mentions new doctor at dinner. Bertie refuses.
Lionel endures a humiliating audition.
reality_condensed: Lionel was an actor but not while he was a speech therapist.

film_condensed: Elizabeth & Bertie cram into Lionel'S elevator.
reality_condensed: Bertie & Elizabeth did visit. The practice had stairs, not an elevator.

film_condensed: A young boy greets them.
Bertie starts treatment but is angry, resistant.
Bertie is persuaded to read aloud while listening to music, is recorded.
Bertie & Elizabeth leave.
reality_condensed: They arrived together & presumably left together.

film_condensed: King George broadcasts a Christmas speech.
George compains about his son's limitations.
reality_condensed: George was frustrated by David's antics.

film_condensed: Bertie stammers while reading George's speech, is shouted at.
reality_condensed: George was impatient with Bertie's stammering.

film_condensed: A stressed Bertie listens to the recording of himself.
Bertie refuses to discuss anything personal with Lionel.
reality_condensed: Bertie did discuss personal stuff with Lionel.

film_condensed: Montage of speech therapy methods.
Bertie's brother David lands in a light aircraft.
David has returned home to visit their dying father.
David insists their father is dying to scupper his relationship with Wallis.
The King is confused & bewildered.
reality_condensed: The king wasn't with it in his final days .

film_condensed: David points out the clocks are set half an hour forward.
Archbishop Lang sucks up to David
The King dies.
David breaks down, crying, holds onto his mother. It's awkward.
David is upset that as King he cannot marry Wallis.
reality_condensed: David wanted Wallis more than kingship.

film_condensed: Lionel acts a scene from Shakespeare.
Lionel is surprised to have Bertie visit him.
reality_condensed: Bertie did have extra duties that kept him away from LIONEL.

film_condensed: We learn Bertie was bullied by his family & nurse.
Elizabeth is unhappy that Wallis has ordered old trees to be felled.
reality_condensed: A similar incident happened at Windsor.

film_condensed: Elizabeth snubs Wallis due to lapse in protocol.
reality_condensed: Wallis broke protocol in doing so.

film_condensed: Elizabeth & Churchill speak. Churchill doesn't like Wallis.
Wallis calls to David to fetch her more wine.
David tells Bertie he plans to marry Wallis. Bertie is shocked, stammers.
reality_condensed: Their conversations aren't in the memoir.

film_condensed: Bertie dejected over his lack of progress. Is encouraged to swear.
reality_condensed: Not in the memoir. No mention of fuckety-fuck.

film_condensed: Lionel encourages Bertie to step up & be great. Bertie offended.
reality_condensed: Lionel wasn't involved. No such scene.

film_condensed: David must abdicate if he marries a commonwoman.
reality_condensed: If David married Wallis he must abdicate.

film_condensed: Lionel at home, upset. His concerned wife offers support.
reality_condensed: Myrtle supported Lionel in his work. Did know he had a royal client.

film_condensed: Lionel waits to see Bertie, is sent away.
Churchill suggests Bertie take over as King.
reality_condensed: Nope. Churchill supported his brother David.

film_condensed: David wants to marry Wallis, no matter what.
David abdicates.
Bertie speaks disastrously before the Accession Council.
reality_condensed: The declaration was halting but not disastrous.

film_condensed: Elizabeth & kids pack their rocKing horses.
Bertie arrives. His daughters curtsy.
Bertie breaks down. He doesn't want to be King.
reality_condensed: Bertie cried when he found out he had to be king.

film_condensed: Posters line the streets: "Stand by our King"
reality_condensed: David had a lot of supporters.

film_condensed: Bertie & Elizabeth visit Lionel's home.
Bertie & Lionel apologise to each other.
Myrtle arrives home to find Elizabeth sitting at her table.
reality_condensed: Nope, but Lionel's family did meet the royals on several occasions..

film_condensed: Lionel introduces the King to his stunned wife.
reality_condensed: Nope. Myrtle already knew he was working with the king.

film_condensed: Bertie & Lionel enter Westminister Abbey to rehearse the coronation.
reality_condensed: Lionel & Bertie rehearsed in the abbey.

film_condensed: Bertie insists Lionel sits in the King's box. Lang is unhappy.
reality_condensed: Lionel & Myrtle sat in the royal box.

film_condensed: Lionel & Bertie rehearse in the abbey.
reality_condensed: Lionel & Bertie rehearsed in the abbey.

film_condensed: Lang has Lionel vetted, challenges his qualifications.
reality_condensed: Lionel never misrepresented himself. Was not challenged by LANG.

film_condensed: Lionel requests Lang clear the premise. Lang is indignant.
Lionel slouches in the royal chair. Bertie is enraged.
reality_condensed: Lionel was too deferent for this behaviour.

film_condensed: Lang informs Lionel he's being replaced. Bertie asserts his authority.
reality_condensed: Lang did suggest an alternative. Bertie insisted on Lionel.

film_condensed: Lionel & Bertie rehearse. It goes well.
reality_condensed: Bertie was pleased with his progress.

film_condensed: HITLER speaking at Nuremberg.
The coronation went well.
Prime Minister Baldwin resigns over handling of Hitler.
War is announced.
Bertie must give a long speech to the nation. He calls for Lionel.
reality_condensed: Lionel was summoned for the address.

film_condensed: Lionel's son drives him to the palace.
reality_condensed: Laurie drove Lionel to the palace.

film_condensed: They have just 40m to broadcast.
Bertie's confidence is low, does some practices.
Bertie in the state room. Churchill offers support.
Broadcast room has been redecorated.
reality_condensed: Lionel took care of the broadcast setting.

film_condensed: Lionel stands right in front of him. Bertie thanks him.
reality_condensed: Lionel supported Bertie throughout. & stood right with him.

film_condensed: The broadcast goes smoothly.
Lionel says he did "quite well"
Bertie is applauded as he poses for an official photo.
reality_condensed: Bertie posed for 'the' photo afterwards. Officials were not there.

film_condensed: Bertie thanks & congratulates Lionel
Elizabeth enters, is proud & relieved.
Bertie received contratulations from officials.
Title: Bertie made Lionel a CVO. Remained friends etc.
reality_condensed: Lionel got a CVO, remained close to Bertie.
